Meta.ShortDescription: Damage to or disease affecting nerves, which may impair sensation, movement, gland or organ function, or other aspects of health, depending on the type of nerve affected.

Symptoms.Symptom: Any problem related to normal nerve function
Loss of autonomic muscle control of cardiovascular, bladder, digestive, or genital muscles.

Causes.Cause: Systemic diseases like diabetes or leprosy
Traumatic injury, including ischemia (restriction of blood supply to tissues)

Diagnostics.Diagnostic: Patient reports numbness, tingling, and pain in feet
Punch biopsy of 3mm layer of skin from calf
Lab tests for vitamin B12 levels, thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) levels

Treatments.Treatment: Blood sugar management in diabetes patients
Intravenous immunoglobulin or steroids for immune-related pateients
Use of cannabis for neuropathic pain
